refnamediv.refpurpose: output a pattern of byte values

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: gencolor repeats a pattern of up to 8192 8-bit values on its standard output. The values, which range from 0 to 255, are taken either from the command line, or in binary from its standard input (if not supplied, a single value of 0, for black, is assumed). The -r flag can be used to specify the number of times to repeat the given pattern, the default being infinity (unless any of -p, -b, -L, and -H are used -- see below). This program is useful for producing a given grey value or color. Note that gencolor will refuse to write its output to a window; you must redirect the output to a file.

-p and -b are used to specify pix file and bw file, respectively. -L and -H are used to specify low resolution and high resolution, respectively. By default, a pix file of low resolution would be assumed; however, use of -r overrules any use of -p, -b, -L, and -H.

refsect1.title: EXAMPLE
refsect1.para: will output 512 "green" pixels (0 255 0 being used as RGB values).
